result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daryl Douglas Sheldon Jr

records.addlTxt: No contact with the victim or their residence.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

10:17 AM Defendant Daryl Douglas Sheldon Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Alysja Otten in court for Daryl Douglas Sheldon Jr.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Def waives all in person hearing KIV.  Case is on for preliminary hearing.  State calls first witness, Detective Patrick Carlson, who is sworn in and testifies.  State asks Court to take judicial notice of 21CF104 and the bond there in; Court does.  Witness has identified the defendant.  Venue is made.  No cross.  State asks for bind-over.  No argument.  Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and the defendant probably committed it.  The matter is bound over for further proceedings.  The State files information.  Case proceeds to arraignment, preserving on motions until next STC.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.  Court notes other cases on for jury trial, but would be willing to take a global plea if one is reached.  Atty Otten argues for signature bond, provides information.  Court will require cash, would consider lowering the cash component if def has an amount he could post.  Atty Rennicke notes multiple offers have been sent in the other matter and will send a global offer to both counsels.  Atty Otten states def unable to post cash at this time.  Court reduces the cash component to $250, same conditions.
Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Status conference on November 17, 2022 at 11:15 am.

2:02 PM Defendant Daryl Douglas Sheldon Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Alysja Otten in court for Daryl Douglas Sheldon Jr. Attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Case on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def enters NG plea to misdemeanors.  Atty Otten argues for bond modification.  State argues against bond modification.  Court denies motion to modify.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 14, 2022 at 10:15 am.

2:08 PM Defendant Daryl Douglas Sheldon Jr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Alysja Otten in court for Daryl Douglas Sheldon Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Def appearing from Polk County Jail.  ADA Schmidt has conflict, needs to stand mute.  Atty Otten requests to adjourn so that they can be heard on bond at next date.
Initial appearance scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Initial appearance on October 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Initial appearance on October 5, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
